      • tagged

        public static co.elastic.clients.elasticsearch._types.query_dsl.Query tagged​(java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> atlanTagNames)
                                                                      throws AtlanException
        Returns a query that will only match assets that have at least one of the Atlan tags provided. This will match irrespective of the Atlan tag being directly applied to the asset, or if it was propagated to the asset.
        Parameters:
        atlanTagNames - human-readable names of the Atlan tags
        Returns:
        a query that will only match assets that have at least one of the Atlan tags provided
        Throws:
        AtlanException - on any error communicating with the API to refresh the Atlan tag cache
        See Also:
        beTaggedByAtLeastOneOf(Collection)

      • beTaggedByAtLeastOneOf

                                                                                      throws AtlanException
        Returns a query that will only match assets that have at least one of the Atlan tags provided. This will match irrespective of the Atlan tag being directly applied to the asset, or if it was propagated to the asset.
        Parameters:
        atlanTagNames - human-readable names of the Atlan tags
        Returns:

        Throws:
        AtlanException - on any error communicating with the API to refresh the Atlan tag cache
        See Also:
        tagged(Collection)

      • tagged

        public static co.elastic.clients.elasticsearch._types.query_dsl.Query tagged​(boolean directly)
        Returns a query that will only match assets that have at least one Atlan tag assigned.
        Parameters:
        directly - when true, the asset must have at least one Atlan tag directly assigned (otherwise even propagated tags will suffice)
        Returns:
        a query that will only match assets that have at least one Atlan tag directly assigned
        See Also:
        beDirectlyTagged(), beTagged()

      • where

        public static QueryFactory.FieldQuery where​(AtlanSearchableField field)
        Returns the start of a query against any field. You need to call one of the operations on the returned FieldQuery object to actually complete building the query against the field.
        Parameters:
        field - to start the query against
        Returns:
        a FieldQuery object that can be used to complete construction of the query
        See Also:
        have(AtlanSearchableField)

      • have

        public static QueryFactory.FieldQuery have​(AtlanSearchableField field)
        Returns the start of a query against any field. You need to call one of the operations on the returned FieldQuery object to actually complete building the query against the field.
        Parameters:
        field - to start the query against
        Returns:
        a FieldQuery object that can be used to complete construction of the query
        See Also:
        where(AtlanSearchableField)

      • where

        public static QueryFactory.FieldQuery where​(java.lang.String cmName,
                                            java.lang.String cmAttributeName)
                                     throws AtlanException
        Returns the start of a query against any custom metadata field. You need to call one of the operations on the returned FieldQuery object to actually complete building the query against the field.
        Parameters:
        cmName - name of the custom metadata set
        cmAttributeName - name of the custom metadata attribute within the set
        Returns:
        a FieldQuery object that can be used to complete construction of the query
        Throws:
        AtlanException - if there is any problem resolving the custom metadata, such as it not existing
        See Also:
        haveCM(String, String)

      • haveCM

                                             java.lang.String cmAttributeName)

        Returns:

        See Also:
        where(String, String)

                                            java.lang.String cmName,
                                            java.lang.String cmAttributeName)

        Returns the start of a query against any custom metadata field. You need to call one of the operations on the returned FieldQuery object to actually complete building the query against the field.

      • getAggregationMetric

        public static double getAggregationMetric​(AggregationResult result)
                                   throws InvalidRequestException
        Retrieve the numeric value from the provided aggregation result.
        Parameters:
        result - the aggregation result from which to retrieve the numeric metric
        Returns:
        the numeric result for the aggregation, or 0.0 in case the aggregation is empty
        Throws:
        InvalidRequestException - if the provided aggregation result is not a metric
